text.text: APF Electronics Inc. Home video game console Second 1978 Cartridge Joystick with 12-button pad

text.name: sys_description
text.text: The APF-MP1000 is a console produced by APF Electronics and released in 1978. It is equipped with a 68000 8 bit processor at 3.579 Mhz and 1 kB of RAM. It can display a resolution of 256x192 pixels in 8 colors and has a built-in speaker. The two controllers are not detachable, they include a joystick and a pad of 12 buttons each. It only works on a color TV and it comes with an inbuilt game, Rocket Patrol. We are very close to what the Intellivision was offering at the same time.
